actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: Concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that during the Nation's present economic crisis, and so long as the county unemployment rate remains at 7 percent or more, emergency unemployment compensation programs should be automatically extended for another quarter to continue benefits for involuntarily unemployed individuals in such localities.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that during the Nation's present economic crisis, and so long as the county unemployment rate remains at 8 percent or more, emergency unemployment compensation programs should be automatically extended for another quarter to continue benefits for involuntarily unemployed individuals in such localities.

titles.title: Concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress that during the Nation's present economic crisis, and so long as the county unemployment rate remains at 7 percent or more, emergency unemployment compensation programs should be automatically extended for another quarter to continue benefits for involuntarily unemployed individuals in such localities.
